intro: Leandra lancifolia var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved leandra, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the humid forests of Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in length and have a smooth, glossy surface. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in clusters, often in shades of white or pale pink, which bloom during the wet season. Its dense foliage and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in warm climates. It thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments and requires high humidity and well-drained, acidic soil.
